default.displayTitle: Microsoft Teams channel and group tabs
default.shortDescription: Create embedded web experiences for a team channel or chat
default.cardPictureAlt: Microsoft Teams channel and group tabs
descriptionParagraphs: Tabs are Microsoft Teams-aware webpages embedded in Microsoft Teams. They can be added as part of a channel or a group chat inside a team or as a personal app for an individual user.
As part of your app, you can add custom tabs to embed your own web content in Teams.
Microsoft Teams tabs can be build in numerous different ways using different technologies.

mediaAssets.alt: Conceptual representation of what tabs look like in the Teams client.

detailItemCategories.name: Scenarios
detailItemCategories.description: Possible html supported text shown just above the list of links

items.name: Bring an existing web-based resource inside Teams.
items.description: You create a personal tab in your Teams app that presents an informational corporate website to users.

items.name: Add support pages to a Teams bot or messaging extension.
items.description: You create personal tabs that provide about and help webpage content to users.

items.name: Provide access to items that your users interact with regularly for cooperative dialogue and collaboration.
items.description: You create a channel/group tab with deep linking to individual items.
